current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exclude
		  from gross income amounts received on account of claims based on certain
		  unlawful discrimination and to allow income averaging for backpay and frontpay
		  awards received on account of such claims, and for other
		  purposes.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text:
Civil Justice Tax Fairness Act of
			 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Exclusion from
			 gross income for amounts received on account of certain unlawful
			 discrimination

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
(relating to items specifically excluded from gross
			 income) is amended by inserting before
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Part III of subchapter B of chapter 1 of the Internal
			 Revenue Code of 1986

header.#text:
Amounts
				received on account of certain unlawful discrimination

text.#text:
Gross
				income does not include amounts received by a claimant (whether by judgment or
				settlement and whether as lump sums or periodic payments) on account of a claim
				of unlawful discrimination.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Civil Justice Tax Fairness Act of 2013/s:139E/ss:a/p:1

text.#text: For purposes of

backpay or
				frontpay, as defined in

punitive
				damages.

term.#tail: has the meaning given such term by

text.#text: For purposes of this section, the term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by inserting before
			 the item relating to section 140 the following new item:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: part III of subchapter B of

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

text.#text: The table of sections for

toc-entry.#text:
Sec. 139E. Amounts received on account of
				certain unlawful
				discrimination.

text.#text:
The amendments made by this section shall apply to amounts
			 received in taxable years beginning after December 31, 2012.

header.#text:
Limitation on
			 tax based on income averaging for backpay and frontpay received on account of
			 certain unlawful employment discrimination

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
(relating to income averaging) is amended by adding at the
			 end the following new section:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Part I of subchapter Q of chapter 1 of the Internal
			 Revenue Code of 1986

header.#text:
Income from
				backpay and frontpay received on account of certain unlawful employment
				discrimination

text.#text:
If employment discrimination backpay or frontpay is received
				by a taxpayer during a taxable year, the tax imposed by this chapter for such
				taxable year shall not exceed the sum of—

the tax which
				would be so imposed if—

no amount of such
				backpay or frontpay were included in gross income for such year, and

no deduction were
				allowed for such year for expenses (otherwise allowable as a deduction to the
				taxpayer for such year) in connection with making or prosecuting any claim of
				unlawful employment discrimination by or on behalf of the taxpayer, plus

the product
				of—

the number of
				years in the backpay period and frontpay period, and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
would increase if the amount on
				which such tax is determined were increased by the average annual net backpay
				and frontpay amount.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Civil Justice Tax Fairness Act of 2013/s:1302/ss:a/p:1

text.#text:
the amount by
				which the tax determined under

For
				purposes of this section—

term.#tail:
means backpay or frontpay receivable
				(whether as lump sums or periodic payments) on account of a claim of unlawful
				employment discrimination.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail: has the meaning provided the term

text.#text: The term
The terms

which are
				includible in gross income in the taxable year as compensation which is
				attributable—

in the case of
				backpay, to services performed, or that would have been performed but for a
				claimed violation of law, as an employee, former employee, or prospective
				employee before such taxable year for the taxpayer’s employer, former employer,
				or prospective employer, and

in the case of
				frontpay, to employment that would have been performed but for a claimed
				violation of law, in a taxable year or taxable years following the taxable
				year, and

which are
				received on account of a judgment or settlement resulting from a claim for a
				violation of law.

term.#tail:
means the period
				during which services are performed (or would have been performed) to which
				backpay is attributable. If such period is not equal to a whole number of
				taxable years, such period shall be increased to the next highest number of
				whole taxable years.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail:
means the period of
				foregone employment to which frontpay is attributable. If such period is not
				equal to a whole number of taxable years, such period shall be increased to the
				next highest number of whole taxable years.

header.#text:
Average annual
				net backpay and frontpay amount

term.#text:
average annual net
				backpay and frontpay amount

text.#text: The term

the excess
				of—

employment
				discrimination backpay and frontpay, over

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Civil Justice Tax Fairness Act of 2013/s:1302/ss:a/p:1/sp:B

text.#text:
the amount of
				deductions that would have been allowable but for

the number of
				years in the backpay period and frontpay
				period.

Sec. 1302. Income from backpay and
				frontpay received on account of certain unlawful employment
				discrimination.

text.#text:
The amendments made by this section shall apply to amounts
			 received in taxable years beginning after December 31, 2012.

header.#text:
Income averaging
			 for backpay and frontpay received on account of certain unlawful employment
			 discrimination not to increase alternative minimum tax liability

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (defining regular tax) is amended by redesignating

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

(relating to averaging of income from backpay or frontpay received on account
				of certain unlawful employment discrimination) shall not apply in computing the
				regular
				tax.

text.#text: Solely for purposes of this section,

header.#text:
Coordination
				with income averaging for amounts received on account of employment
				discrimination

text.#text:
The amendment made by this section shall apply to taxable
			 years beginning after December 31, 2012.
